meanings.definition: To thaw out or become unfrozen.
meanings.sent1: I left the frozen meat on the counter to unthaw before cooking it.
meanings.sent2: Remember to unthaw the frozen berries before making the smoothie.
meanings.sent3: The sun's warmth helped unthaw the icy pond, allowing the ducks to swim freely.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the power to unthaw even the coldest of hearts.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's quick actions were able to unthaw the frozen hydrant, saving the building from destruction.

meanings.sent1: We need to unthaw the windshield before driving in the winter.
meanings.sent2: The sun will unthaw the snow on the roof, causing it to slide off.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to unthaw the frozen fish by sitting on it, thinking it was a warm rock.
meanings.sent4: His words had the power to unthaw the tension in the room, bringing peace to all.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the fire slowly began to unthaw her frozen fingers, providing much-needed relief.
